Speaker: senior resident
Dialogue: Intubate her!

Speaker: resident
Dialogue: Blood-pressure's forty and falling --

Speaker: senior resident
Dialogue: Jesus, her water's broken --  She's going into uterine contractions --

Speaker: dennis
Dialogue: So where we going?

Speaker: raquel
Dialogue: It's a surprise.

Speaker: dennis
Dialogue: I likes surprises.

Speaker: raquel
Dialogue: What do you have down there, little man?

Speaker: dennis
Dialogue: Heat-seeker.

Speaker: raquel
Dialogue: I'll bet.

Speaker: dennis
Dialogue: What the fuck are we doing here?

Speaker: dennis
Dialogue: Fuck, I need a drink!!!

Speaker: raquel
Dialogue: What's wrong, baby?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Where is Deacon Frost?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Got something in your throat.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: Fuck you, Day-walker, I ain't saying shit --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Frost.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: You won't stop him, Blade. The Tide's rising, the Sleeper's gonna --

Speaker: dennis
Dialogue: Please don't --

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Brought you a baked potato, nice and crispy. Still warm, too.

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: Jesus, that's rank --

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: What's his story?

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Paramedics said he was still screaming when they found him. Looks like some joker had stapled him to a wall.

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: Pretty.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You took this off a DOA?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: This isn't human blood.

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: Then what is it?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I don't know --  Look at this blood smear --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: The red blood cells are biconvex, which is theoretically impossible. They're hypochromic, there's virtually no hemoglobin in them.  Look at the PMNs, they're binucleated, they should be mononucleated.

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: What about the chemistry panel?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Blood sugar level is three times the norm, phosphorous and uric acid are off the scales.  Like the woman said, impossible.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Curtis, it's three in the morning. I'm really not in the mood for one of your practical jokes.

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: It's not a joke. I've got the stiff sitting in the morgue right now -- look, just come up and see him, okay? Five minutes, that's all I ask.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I thought you promised to give me some distance?

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: This is purely professional curiosity, Karen, I swear.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Five minutes, not a second more. And I don't want to hear a word about "us".

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: No problem.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You haven't started in on the internal organs?

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: That's weird --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: He looks different now, burns are less extreme, some of these wounds have closed up --

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: Tell me something, honestly, you ever have second thoughts about us?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Sometimes --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: -- but then I remember what an ass-hole you were and I'm snapped back to reality.

Speaker: curtis
Dialogue: Jesus, Karen, you're breaking my heart here --

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: -- more -- blood --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Now don't we look dapper?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: My shoulder -- dislocated --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Whistler!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: She's been bitten.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: You should've killed her, then.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: She hasn't turned yet.  You can help her.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: No promises. You watch her close. She starts to turn, you finish her off.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Localized necrosis. She's borderline. Another hour and she'd be well into the change.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Can you hear me, woman?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What -- ?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: You've been bitten by a vampire. We've got to try and burn out the venom, just like a rattlesnake bite --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Hold her.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: "Dr. Karen Jansen". Listen close, I'm going to inject you with an antidote made from allium setivum -- garlic. This is going to hurt. A lot.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: The Day Walker represents a unique opportunity. We'd be fools to waste it by killing him.

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: Deacon Frost. You refuse to speak our language, you insult the House of Erebus by using the humans' gutter-tongue, have you no respect for tradition?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Why should I respect something which has outlived its purpose?

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: I see. And what would you have us do with this "half-breed"?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Study him. Unlock the secrets of his DNA. He's the key we've been looking for.

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: He is an abomination!

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Why should we spend our lives cringing from the daylight when his blood offers us an alternative? Enough talk. It's time we stepped out of the shadows!

Speaker: pallintine
Dialogue: You're out of line, Frost.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Am I? Or am I just the first to say out loud what we've all been thinking?

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: The shadows suit us, Frost. We've existed this way for thousands of years. Who are you to challenge our ways?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Someone who's sick of living off scraps. The coming age belongs to us, not the humans!  When the final war between our races comes, who do you want leading the charge?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Some withered up fossil ready to snap like a brittle bone at the first sign of change?

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: Get out!!!

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Careful, old fang. You might wake up one day and find yourself extinct.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Just do it, old man.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You shouldn't be here.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Who are you people?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: My name is Abraham Whistler.  This is Blade. As for our little homunculus here --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: -- he's a vampire.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You're joking --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Not at all. You're looking at a prime specimen of the homines nocturna.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: If Blade hadn't brought you here, you would've wound up like him.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Why did you help me?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Stupidity.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Maybe not. I did some checking, she's a hematologist. Knowledge like that might come in handy.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: It's not worth the risk. We can't trust her.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Because you're tainted. The venom's still inside you. You could still turn on us.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What happens then?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Then I have to take you out, just like any other bloodsucker.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: We hunt them, moving from one city to the next, tracking their migrations. They're hard to kill. They tend to regenerate.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: So what do you use, then? A stake?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Some of the old wives' tales are true -- they're severely allergic to silver, various types of wood. Feed them garlic and they'll go into anaphylactic shock --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: -- and of course there's always sunlight, ultra-violet rays.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: And you honestly expect me to believe all this?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I don't care what you believe. I saved your life once, I don't plan on making a habit of it. You want my advice, you'll be out of the city by nightfall. If you're stupid enough to stay, that's your business.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I can't just leave. I have a life here, a career --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: There's a war going on out there. Blade, myself, a few others -- we've tried to keep it from spilling over onto the streets.  Sometimes people like yourself get caught in the cross-fire.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I can go to the police. I have blood samples back at the hospital. I can show them.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Do it. You'll be dead before you can file the complaint.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: That's ridiculous! No one's that powerful.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Get in. Youre leaving.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Wait.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Consider it a parting gift. Vampire mace -- silver nitrate, essence of garlic.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: So that's it? You guys just patch me up and send me on my way?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: There is one other thing. I'd buy yourself a gun if I were you. If you start becoming sensitive to the daylight, if you start becoming thirsty regardless of much you've had to drink -- then I suggest you take that gun and use it on yourself. Better that, than the alternative.

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: These archives are restricted to members of the House of Erebus.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Please. You and the other Elders wouldn't know what to do with these texts if your lives depended on it.  Which, of course, they do.

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: You're wasting your time, Frost. Far greater scholars than you have tried to decipher these words. Whatever secrets they hold have been lost.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Perhaps.

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: What are you up to, Frost?

Speaker: frost's voice
Dialogue: Wouldn't you like to know, Old Fang?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Remember what we said. Keep your eyes open. They're everywhere.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I need the police. This is an emergency --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Hello? My name is Karen Jansen, I was with Curtis Webb at Mid-Town Hospital last night -- that's right, I witnessed the attack --  115 Aurora, apartment 3G. Yes, I'll wait here. Please hurry.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Get a grip on yourself, girl.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Who is it?

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Sergeant Gideon. I'm responding to a 911 call.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Yes, that was me, I'm Karen Jansen --

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Are you all right?  I'm glad you called, Ms. Jansen, we've been anxious to get a hold of you. You disappeared on us for a while.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I know. Listen -- do you have any idea what happened to Curtis, the other doctor?

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Oh, he's dead. But I wouldn't worry about that if I were you.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Because you're dead too.

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Garlic?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: He said it would work against vampires --

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Who said I was a vampire?

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Thanks for the laugh. You can shut your eyes if you want to.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: How did you know?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Figured they'd send someone after you. Thought I'd wait around and see who showed up.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You used me as bait?!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: It worked, didn't it?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: But, he could've --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: He didn't. Get over it.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: But he's a policeman --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: He's a familiar. A human who works for the vampires. See this mark?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: That's a glyph, kind of like a vampire cattle brand. That means Officer Friendly here is someone's property. Any of the other vampire's try to bleed him, they'll have to answer to Friendly's owner --  This glyph belongs to Deacon Frost. We've been tracking him for a while now --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Why in God's name would anyone want to work for them?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Because they're vampire wanna-bes. If they're loyal, if they prove themselves, then their masters will turn them.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: And that's a good thing?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: For some. Live forever, never get old. The ultimate high.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: How 'bout you, Officer? You a good little bloodhound?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Looks like our friend was blood-running.  Where were you headed?

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Mphuck you --

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Jesus -- 1227 Brookner -- Holliston Clinic --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What are you doing?!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Preventive medicine.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You can't do this, he's human, it's murder.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: It's war, now get the fuck out of the way!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: God-damnit!!! Do you have any idea what you just did?! He'll warn them. They'll be waiting!

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You were going to kill him. What was I supposed to do?! Shut my eyes and pretend I didn't see what I saw?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Let me set you straight on something, Doctor. What you've "seen" so far is nothing. The world you live in's just the sugar-coated topping. There's another world beneath it, the real world -- and it's a fucking bloodbath. If you want to survive in it, you'd better pull your head out of your ass.

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Look, I know you're disappointed --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Crestfallen.

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: Blade was waiting for me. There wasn't anything I could do.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Tell me something, Gideon, what blood type are you?

Speaker: gideon
Dialogue: I don't really know --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Take a wild stab. A? B? O, perhaps? I'm interested in the antigens here, the agglutination reaction --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: I'm going to guess AB positive.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: AB positive. Give the man a prize.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing?! I could have killed you!

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I remembered the address. I followed you --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Do you have a death wish or are you just stupid?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Look, if what you say is true, if there's a chance I could turn into one of them, then I've got no choice, do I? I have to work with you. I need to learn everything I can about them. It's the only way I'll be able to find a cure for myself.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: There is no cure.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You don't know that.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What are you looking at?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: What do you see here?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Graffiti --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Look closer.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: This isn't a gang tag, it's a vampire marking. It means there's a safe-house nearby. A place they can go if dawn is coming.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I know this place -- it's a blood bank.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Owned by vampires. There's one of these in every major city, and just like Domino's, they always deliver.  You telling me you're ready to walk through that door?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: All right, then, listen up, Vampire Anatomy 101. Crosses and running water don't do dick, so forget what you've seen in the movies.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You use the stake, silver, or sunlight, got it?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Know how to use one of these?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Safety's off, round's already chambered --  Silver hollow-points filled with garlic. You aim for the heart or the head, anything else is a one-way ticket to a pine box.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Get out. Now.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I know you're blood-running. Who's your sponsor?

Speaker: tanaka
Dialogue: I don't know what you're --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What if you've made a mistake?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: What's this? A birthmark?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: How much are you shipping?

Speaker: tanaka
Dialogue: Bite me!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I've got a message for your masters -- the night's no longer safe for their kind.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You let him go --  An hour ago you were ready to kill a man for less, this one didn't even talk.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: He will.

Speaker: automated voice
Dialogue: "You've reached a number that is no longer in service. Please consult your operator and try again".

Speaker: tanaka's voice
Dialogue: It's Tanaka, PIN number sixteen-zero-zero-nine --

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: tanaka
Dialogue: Get me Pearl!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Pearl is feeding --

Speaker: tanaka
Dialogue: Look, I'm not fucking around here! That hunter Frost has been talking about? He was just at the clinic. Tore the goddamn place apart!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Looks like we hit pay-dirt. This place is crawling with them.  See the valets over there? They're vampires. So is the doorman.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: How can you tell?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: The way they move, they way they smell --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: The whore on the corner, she's one too. So are the two men standing under the streetlight.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: So many of them -- I still can't believe they're real.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: There are worse things than vampires out there.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Like what?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Like me.

Speaker: doorman
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir -- do you have an invitation?

Speaker: kid
Dialogue: Hey --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Where's the entrance?!

Speaker: tanaka
Dialogue: I can't -- they'll kill me!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I got news for you, butt-boy. You're already dead.

Speaker: tanaka
Dialogue: Oh God, shit -- behind the bookcase --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: After you.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What is this place?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Some kind of archive --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Isn't this all a little high-tech? I thought vampires were more into cobwebs and coffins.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You've been watching too much TV. They've got their claws sunk into everything -- finance, real estate, politics. Probably own half of Downtown.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: This must be where they keep their records --

Speaker: pearl's voice
Dialogue: Lorca, is that you?

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: He's here!

Speaker: frost's voice
Dialogue: Congratulations, Day-Walker.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Frost?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: In the flesh, Blade. I understand you've been looking for me. I'm flattered.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Don't be. You're another notch on my sword hilt, nothing else.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You're quick, Blade, I'll give you that. In the space of an hour you've crossed my familiar, destroyed a blood bank --  Now here you are in the heart of our archives, terrorizing our curator.

Speaker: pearl's voice
Dialogue: He has a knife to my throat, Frost! He --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Round one to you, Blade.

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: A sun lamp. We're gonna play twenty questions. Depending on your answers, you might get to have yourself a tanning session.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: What were you in such a big hurry to delete just now?

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: It's an epistle, a letter Frost has been translating -- it prophesizes LaMagra's return.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: And who is LaMagra?

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: LaMagra is The Sleeper!!!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Where's the original, Pearl? You must have it around here somewhere.

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: The vault --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: If he moves, cook him.

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: Please, I'll give you the combination -- you'll damage the documents --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: That's the point.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: He moved.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What are these?

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: Hola, amigo. Remember me?

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: You took my arm, Blade. But that's okay, I'm growing a new one --

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: Nice, huh? Think I'll ever play the piano again?  You can slice him, you can dice him, and the man just keeps on coming.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: Stay with me, sweetness, I'm not through with you yet.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: Teak. Nice craftsmanship.  Which reminds me, Blade, think I owe you one --

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: Actually, if you want to get technical, I owe you two.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: What's so funny, bright eyes?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I'm expecting some company.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Get down!

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Christ, I'm too old for this. Somebody get me a goddamn wheelchair.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: How did you find us?!

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: We keep in radio contact.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You've been listening in the whole time?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: You think I'd let him run loose without a chaperone? Blade ferrets their rat-holes out, I map them. Then we blow them all to kingdom come.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: There's a subway line due East of here. We'd best make tracks.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Whistler!

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Go on, I'll be fine!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: He can take care of himself! GO!!!

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You're hurt --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Nothing that won't heal by dawn.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I need help with this --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What am I injecting you with?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Serum -- it's a human hemoglobin substitute.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You're one of them, aren't you?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Not quite. I'm a hybrid. Half-human, half-vampire.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: What took you so long?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Don't even start, old man.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me the truth about him?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: We weren't sure we could trust you.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Blade's mother was attacked by a vampire while she was pregnant. Ultimately, she died, but her unborn child lived. Unfortunately, he'd undergone certain genetic changes while in the womb --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: I found Blade when he was thirteen. He'd been living on the streets, feeding off the homeless. Apparently the Thirst manifested itself at puberty --  I took him for one of them at first, almost killed him, too. But then I realized what he was.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: He took my fucking hand! Again!

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You seem to be in the habit of losing them fairly often, Quinn. Maybe the amputee lifestyle just suits you.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: We need to find him, tonight.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Down, boy. Blade's not going anywhere. I promise. Right now, though, we've more pressing business --  It's time Dragonetti paid the piper.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Blade's unique, you know. A one in a billion anomaly. He can withstand sunlight, garlic, even silver. But he still has the Thirst.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What happens if he doesn't take the serum?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: The Thirst overcomes him, just like the others. It's not something he can control.  The problem is, time's running out. His body's starting to reject the serum. And so far, all my efforts to find a cure have ended in failure --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: No offense, Whistler, but you're not exactly working with state of the art equipment here. You might have missed something.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Which is why you're here. We could use someone with your experience.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: This used to be mine, you know. It's been passed down through the centuries, from one hunter to the next --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Why do you hunt them?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Habit, mostly, just like this.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: I had a family once -- a wife, three daughters. Then a drifter named Deacon Frost came calling one evening --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: He killed them?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Eventually. He toyed with them first. He made me choose, do you understand? Which order they would die in --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: How did you escape?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: I didn't. He was cruel enough to let me live.  Even gave me a souvenir to remember him by.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: And now you're using Blade to exact your revenge?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Frost's bodycount keeps rising, and I'm not getting any younger, am I?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: I wouldn't go in there if I were you. It's best to leave him alone when he's like this.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'll take my chances.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Blade?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: It's dark in here.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You get used to the darkness.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Whistler told me about your mother.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I can't close my eyes without hearing her scream.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Those aren't real memories. No one has that kind of recall.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I do. I remember from day one. People staring at me, sensing I was different. Watching the fear grow in their eyes, knowing in their hearts I wasn't human.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: If you're not human, then why do you bleed like us? I've seen vampire blood, you don't have it running through your veins.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Just get out of here.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Blade --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I said, GET OUT!!!

Speaker: frost's voice
Dialogue: Rise and shine, little wing.

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: What is this? Where am I?!

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: When was the last time you stopped to appreciate a sunrise, Dragonetti? Three, four hundred years?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: How do you like that? Right on time.

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: The other elders will never let you get away with this!

Speaker: dragonetti
Dialogue: Don't you see, you fools?! He'll betray you too! He's planning on invoking LaMagra himself!

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: The wheel turns, old fang. Guess you just got a little too long in the tooth.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Dragonetti was right. You were fools to trust me.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Going somewhere?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: China Town. I need more serum.  What's all this?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I made a trip to the hospital last night, borrowed some equipment.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: For your miracle cure?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: She's been making real progress, Blade.  Show him --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: This is sodium citrate. It's an anti-coagulant. We use it to treat blood-clots sometimes. Vampire blood is thinner than humans, though. Watch what happens when I introduce some into a sample --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Can you imagine what a dash of that would do on your sword?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Before you go, I'd like to take a sample of your blood.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Is he sick?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Cancer.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You care about him, don't you?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: We've got a good arrangement, that's all. Whistler makes the weapons, I use them, the vampires die -- end of story.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: My mother used to say that a cold heart is a dead heart.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Your mother sounds like a Hallmark greeting card.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I'd wish you luck, Doc, but I never put much stock in optimism.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: How's it going, Kam?

Speaker: kam
Dialogue: You're a week early.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I was in the neighborhood.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Whistler says I'm building up a resistance to it.

Speaker: kam
Dialogue: I was afraid that might happen.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Maybe it's time to start exploring other alternatives.

Speaker: kam
Dialogue: There's only one alternative to the serum.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Yeah. I know.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Thanks, Kam.  One other thing. Have you ever heard of a vampire called the Sleeper?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I found this in there archives. I need to find someone who can read their language.

Speaker: kam
Dialogue: I've heard about a woman named Miracia. Some say she's a mayombero, a Santeria witch. Supposedly she lives in that tent community down by the city dump. I'm told she only sees people at night.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Afternoon, Blade.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Easy.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Wouldn't want our little friend here to wind up on the back of a milk carton, would we?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Beautiful day, isn't it?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: How can you be out here?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: I dabble in pharmaceuticals, medical research. We've developed a type of sun-blocker using octyl salicylate, a few others things.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: It's not very effective in direct sunlight, but it's a start. The goal, of course, is to be like you, "the Day-walker".

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I don't buy it.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Why not? The future of our race runs through your bloodstream. You've got the best of both worlds, Blade. All of our strengths and none of our weaknesses.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Maybe I don't see it that way.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Oh, so it's back to pretending we're human again, is it? Spare me the Uncle Tom routine. You can't keep denying what you are. You're one of us, Blade. You always have been.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You're wrong.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Am I? You think the humans will ever accept a half-breed like you? They can't. They're afraid of you.  The humans fear us because we're superior. They fear us because in their hearts they know their race has become obsolete.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Look at them, just an endless stream of cattle in a mad race to the slaughterhouse.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: The pause that refreshes --  Care for some? Smells good, doesn't it? Pungent, with just an irrepressible hint of iron.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Pass.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You sure now? I bled a newborn for this. You won't find a drink that's sweeter.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Tell me honestly, do you really get the same rush from that pasteurized piss-serum of yours?  You're surprised I know about your serum? You shouldn't be. I know everything about you.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You can't keep walking the razor's edge, Blade. The day will come -- and soon, when you'll have to choose between our kind and their's. If I were you, I'd take care not to wind up on the wrong end of the fang.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Love to continue this chat, but it appears I'm melting.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You're not going anywhere.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Watch me.

Speaker: mercury
Dialogue: This is Mercury. Tell Deacon I've found their hiding place.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Any progress?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Some. It's been slow --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You don't look so good.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'm just tired, that's all. We've been up all night.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You've got another day or two at most.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: For what it's worth, I'm sorry.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You make it sound like I'm already dead.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Extranjero. Quien es?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I'm here to see Miracia. Kam sent me.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: This way.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: All right, let's start with the basics -- why do vampires need to drink blood?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Their own blood can't sustain hemoglobin.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Then vampirism is a genetic defect, just like Hemolytic anemia?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: So what about gene therapy?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Basically you'd have to re-write the victim's DNA, alter it so that the DNA will produce proteins capable of generating hemoglobin.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: With a retrovirus. It's injected into the bone marrow cells, it causes the host's DNA to mutate. They've been using them to treat Sickle-cell anemia.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: You're serious? You actually think this could work?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: On me, yes. On Blade, I'm not so sure --  The problem is, Blade didn't contract the vampire virus from a bite like I did. He was born with it. The irony is, I could probably cure every vampire but him.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Then we're back to square one, aren't we? Sooner or later, the Thirst always wins.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What happened to the power?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: I don't know, but the back-up generator should've kicked in.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: UV floodlights are down too.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Get it!!!

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Understand this -- they are monsters. Hesitate for even a moment, and you've lost.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: It's been a long time, hasn't it, "old friend"?

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: Is something wrong, my friend?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You're blind --

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: There are other ways to see. Sit.

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: Perhaps you have brought me something -- an offering for the orishas?

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: Hold out your hands.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I didn't come here to get my palms read. I need something translated.

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: Show me.

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: Sangre. Written in blood.

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: This is an old tongue, from an old world. It concerns LaMagra.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Who is LaMagra?

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: The vampire God. This speaks of His return.

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: "-- there will come a Day Walker."  "His blood will call the Sleeper from beyond the Veil of Tears."

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: His blood -- ?

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: The Day Walker's blood is a disparador -- a trigger, you see? For LaMagra's return. One need only consume it and the spirit of his ancestors will settle upon him.  "And the Sleeper will rise from the shadows anew, cleansing the world in a Tide of Blood."

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: "The Blood Tide".

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: Yes. The vampire apocalypse. It is said that all who feel its taint will succumb to the Thirst.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: How do I stop it?

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: The Great Wheel turns, my friend. The Dark is rising. How would you fight a shadow?

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: I am tired. Dawn is coming.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: But I just got here --

Speaker: miracia
Dialogue: You've been here longer than you think.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: WHISTLER?!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Jesus, Whistler, what did they do to you?

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Frost took her --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Don't try to talk --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Listen. You have to -- finish me off. You don't want me coming back.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: No, we can treat the wounds --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Too far gone, you know that.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Whistler, I can't.

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Yes you can. Now get on with it.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Whistler, I --

Speaker: whistler
Dialogue: Just be quick about it, will you? Do it right.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Hello, Blade. By the time you watch this, Whistler will no doubt be winging his way to Heaven, thanks to your capable hands. If it makes any difference to you, he put up quite a fight.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Now, I'm sure you're wondering about Ms. Jansen's well-being. She's alive and kicking -- "ambulatory", as they like to say in the trade. Whether or not she remains so is entirely up to you.  I'll make this as easy as possible for you, Blade. You can find us at the Edgewood Towers. We'll be waiting with baited breath.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Well, here we are, Doctor.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Why haven't you killed me yet?

Speaker: mercury
Dialogue: Deacon likes to play with his food before he eats it.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: How many of you are there?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: A few thousand scattered about the globe. In the past, we've had to restrict our numbers for fear of discovery. That won't be necessary after tonight.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: What happens then?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: The Blood Tide. Our long-prophesied holy war against the humans. There's a force, you see -- a spirit that exists in our blood. I've discovered a way to invoke it.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: LaMagra --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: That's right. The answers were there all along, of course, scribbled down in the forgotten languages of my kind. Waiting for someone with the patience to decipher them. My elders were foolish enough to dismiss them as wives tales. But I knew better.  Imagine my surprise when Blade turned out to be the key which would set that force free.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: LaMagra isn't a physical being. He's a spirit, requiring a flesh and blood host in order to manifest himself.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Who better to usher in the Blood Tide?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: There's no need for any of this. Your condition can be treated. Whistler and I were working on a cure when --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: What makes you think we want to be cured? Blood is only part of the equation. The hunt, the killing, that's what the Thirst is really about.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: But you use blood banks --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Only as a last resort. Preserved blood is inferior. There's no flavor left to it, no life.  Fortunately, I've found a way around that particular obstacle.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Under these conditions I can keep a donor alive for years, producing anywhere from fifty to a hundred pints of blood.  Of course, this is just a pilot program, really. Once the Tide comes, we'll need to expand production. So many more mouths to feed --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: You're a monster.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Why? Because we live at another species' expense? Your people farm cattle and veal, don't they? Fattening them up with steroids? It's called evolution, Doctor. Survival of the fittest.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: I have a wake-up call for the human race. You're no longer at the top of the food chain.

Speaker: vampire
Dialogue: You think I'm afraid of that toothpick of yours?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You should be. I've made some improvements.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Jason.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Mother -- ?!

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: I've missed you so much, Jason.  You have no idea what I've been through, how much I've wanted to see you --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: But you -- died --

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Deacon brought me back.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Fight him --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: She can't. She's one of my thralls now. She has about as much free will as a puppet on a string.  You love me, don't you, Vanessa?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: What do we have here? Your precious serum? I don't think you'll be needing this anymore.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Please --

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Listen to your father, Jason. It's going to be a better world.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Don't look so surprised, Blade. You've spent your life looking for the vampire who fathered you. Well you can rest easy now, you've found him.  Daddy's here.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: It's true, Blade. You've got my blood running through your veins.  Thirty years ago. A moonlit street, a woman on her way home alone. You were conceived the night I tore my fangs into your mother's flesh.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Are you all right?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I've been better --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: How long have we been driving?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I don't know. I woke up just before you did --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Is it bad?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: We get out of this alive, maybe I'll take that miracle cure of yours.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: It won't work on you.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Your condition's congenital, the genetic mutations occurred in utero. All the other victims contracted vampirism after birth.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I can't cure you, Blade. I can cure myself, but I can't cure you.  I'm so sorry.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Welcome home, children.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: On its surface, this building houses one of the city's oldest financial institutions -- and for over two-hundred years its served our corporate needs. Look beneath the surface, however, and you'll discover another truth entirely --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: As above, so below.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Welcome to our hall of ancients, Doctor. We call it the Temple of Night.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Let's see this sword of his.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Still quite sharp, I see.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Blade --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You're wasting your breath, woman. He can't hear you now. It's the Thirst, you see? It already has him in its grip.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: How long has it been since you had your serum? Twelve hours? More? You must be quite thirsty by now.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: What does it feel like? Is your blood on fire? Are you burning up inside? Give in to the Thirst, Blade. Embrace your true nature.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: -- go to hell --

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: I've got news for you, Blade. We're already here.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Take him to the sanctuary. It's time he was bled.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: I'd let you watch the proceedings, Doctor, but I'm afraid that privilege is reserved for members of my own race. Don't worry, though, I've made alternate arrangements for you.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: We call this the Bone Pit. It's where we keep our mistakes, the ones who couldn't successfully make the transition from human to vampire.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: They'll feed on anything, given the chance -- animals, corpses, even other vampires.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Of course, a strapping young woman like yourself -- well I think you just might be considered finger food.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: It's been a long road, hasn't it? Such a pity Whistler led you so far astray.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: I don't blame you, though. I want you to know that. Even after all you've done. I understand, Blade, I really do. It's the human side of you which has corrupted your reasoning, made you weak. But we'll take care of that, won't we?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I'd kill myself -- before I turned into something like you.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: No you wouldn't. I'm going to bleed you dry, Blade. All the poison that makes you human.  When the Tide comes, you'll be begging me put you through the Change.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: It's done. We should ready ourselves for the ritual of invocation.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: How could you be a part of this?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: These are my people now. I'm one of them.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You don't have to be.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: You don't understand. I've killed, I've hunted, and I've enjoyed it.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: I wish you could see the world as I do. Deacon opened my eyes. There's no turning back from that.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I don't believe that.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: You will. Time is on our side. Sooner or later, the Thirst always wins.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Mother!

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Your mother died the night you were born.

Speaker: revenant
Dialogue: Karreennnnnn. I never thought I'd see you againnnnn.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Curtis?!

Speaker: curtis revenant
Dialogue: Tell, me, Karennn -- ever have second thoughts -- about us?

Speaker: mercury
Dialogue: It won't be long now, lover.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: We should finish him off.

Speaker: mercury
Dialogue: No. Deacon wants him turned.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: Fucking waste, if you ask me.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Tonight is the night we've waited our entire lives for. Tonight, the blood-dimmed Tide is loosed upon the world. Tonight, the Age of Man comes to an end.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Blade.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: "And what rough beast, its hour come round at last, slouches towards Bethlehem to be born?"

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Get out of here --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I'm not leaving without you.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You don't understand. The Thirst --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: -- tearing me -- apart.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I know. Take some of my blood.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: No --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: It's the only way. You know that. We'll never get out of here alive if you don't.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I can't -- I won't be able to stop --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Yes you will. The human side of you is stronger. I know it is.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Don't stop --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: My God --

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Are you -- all right?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Never been better.

Speaker: mercury
Dialogue: Deacon?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: No longer.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Who dies first?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Take him.

Speaker: quinn
Dialogue: Grew another hand for you sweetmeat --  -- and now I'm gonna kill you with it.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Let's see if you can grow a new one of these!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Next?

Speaker: mercury
Dialogue: Have a taste of your own medicine!

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You're too late, Blade. I'm already changing. Don't you see? The Sleeper has awakened. I'm not just Frost anymore. I'm becoming a god now, blood incarnate.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Did you think I'd forgotten you, you little whore?

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You can't hurt me anymore.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Where are you?!

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Everywhere.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You want my blood so much?! Take it!

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: I was wrong about you, Blade. You were never one of us. You're a traitor to your race.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: Blade!

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: Guess you're not quite as invulnerable as you thought.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You're wrong -- a few minutes more, and my transition will be complete. Even your sword won't be able to affect me then.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: You don't have a few minutes, Frost.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: Just as I thought. Still chained to your mother's breast after all these years.

Speaker: frost
Dialogue: You're too human, Blade.

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: It's because I'm human that I can do this.

Speaker: karen
Dialogue: I never imagined I'd be so happy to see the sun rise --  It's over, isn't it?

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: For them. But for me --

Speaker: blade
Dialogue: I feel like it's finally beginning.
